pr_title: fix(client): adding support to provide a plain okhttp client with sys…

timeline.message: fix(client): adding support to provide a plain okhttp client with system defaulted ssl socket factory

timeline.bodyText: Hm, I feel like I'm missing something here.  So is it assumed that a PlainServiceEndpoint will have a keystore and a truststore?
timeline.author: jonsie

replies.bodyText: We will assign system defaults to both and we will not use the keystore and truststore provided in the app configuration.
replies.author: srekapalli

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure about Plain but otherwise this seems reasonable to me.
Maybe Simple or Basic?
timeline.author: ajordens
timeline.diffHunk:

If a client is constructed using this type, system defaults will be used for socket factory + * and trust manager. + */ +public class PlainServiceEndpoint extends DefaultServiceEndpoint {

replies.bodyText: I ended up modifying to be another attribute on the service endpoint instead of a separate data type.
replies.author: srekapalli
